content:
• Friday, May 16, 2014

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RNF +3.0%. QUIK +2.7%. VOD +1.7%. HOME-OLD +1.6%. INVN +1.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SMCI -9.0%. ADSK -7.3%. BXE -2.9%. GTI -2.6%. MELI -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • QUIK

    QuickLogic soars; SA Pro author predicts revenues will surge

    • In an SA Pro article embargoed until 5AM ET Saturday, Domino Analytics' Brian Coleman argues QuickLogic's (QUIK +17.8%) big post-earnings selloff (the result of soft Q2 guidance) isn't justified in light of the company's upbeat 2H14/2015 outlook.
    • Coleman sees design win opportunities for top customer Samsung's flagship devices, and calls QuickLogic's next-gen ArcticLink 3 S2 sensor hub "a radical game-changer."
    • QuickLogic took off last October after the company unveiled its ArcticLink 3 S1 sensor hub.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: EPI +10.17%. FXI +4.05%. EWY +3.82%. EEM +3.15%. VWO +3.05%.
    • Losers: VXX -4.49%. UNG -2.63%. REMX -2.12%. GAZ -2.00%. TAN -1.94%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • TROV

    Investors lose patience with Trovagene

    • Shares of thinly traded nano cap Trovagene (TROV -8.8%) continue their slide today on 4x higher volume. Prices have now cratered 66% from the $10.27 August 5 high.
    • The company reported Q1 results earlier in the week. Notable by their absence are any revenues from its much-ballyhooed transrenal nucleic acid tests. It launched a BRAF test in its CLIA lab in October of last year and a KRAS test in March, but no revenues have been generated yet. Per its 10-Q, all of its $111K in revenues come from NPM1 royalties.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 6 Comments
  • JE

    Just Energy -16.5% as TD Securities downgrades

    • Just Energy (JE -16.5%) plunges after TD Securities downgrades shares to Reduce from Buy with a C$5 price target, down from C$10, and warns the company may cut its dividend.
    • TD says it trimmed its target multiple by 1.5x to a still healthy 7.25x to reflect slower growth rates and execution risk; the firm's lower valuation also comes from a reduced base EBITDA forecast because of deteriorating net customer adds, margins and growth rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • BXE

    Bellatrix cuts Q2 production forecast, shares -2.6%

    • Bellatrix Exploration (BXE -2.6%) slides after cutting its forecast for Q2 production, citing unscheduled temporary downtime in Alberta.
    • BXE reduces its Q2 production guidance to ~38K boe/day and FY 2014 outlook to ~41K boe/day; cash flow forecasts for the quarter and year remain unchanged as higher commodity prices are expected to offset the restricted production.
    • Says its 2014 drilling program in the Cardium and Spirit River intervals has achieved a 100% success rate, with the wells productivity meeting internal type curves.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics +30%, settles litigation with AGR Well Management

    • Hyperdynamics (HDY +29.9%) says it settled litigation in London involving AGR Well Management concerning the drilling of the Sabu #1 well offshore Guinea in 2011-12.
    • HDY's SCS Corp. subsidiary will receive $17.7M from the escrow account previously established by the parties; the claims by SCS and the counterclaims of AGR will be released, and the litigation will be terminated.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • XGTI

    xG Technology -7.7% post-earnings; Feltl downgrades

    • Up AH yesterday following its Q1 report, xG Technology (XGTI -7.7%) is now selling off. A downgrade to Hold from Feltl isn't helping.
    • xG spent $2.45M on R&D in Q1 (+49% Y/Y), and $1.68M on G&A (+24%). Ahead of an April stock offering that yielded gross proceeds of $10M, the company ended Q1 with just $686K in cash (down from $5.5M at the end of 2013).
    • Along with its Q1 results, xG announces it has been awarded a Mexican patent related to the SIP protocol (used to set up VoIP transmissions). The company now has 60 U.S. and 137 international patents/applications, of which 113 are issued patents.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • SSC-OLD

    You On Demand slumps; Q1 report reveals $748K gross loss

    • You On Demand's (YOD -7.7%) Q1 cost of revenue was $876K, more than 6x revenue of $138K. That translates into a gross loss of $738K.
    • Opex fell 22% Y/Y to $1.98M; You attributes this to overhead expense control and its revenue-sharing strategy with content partners.
    • The Chinese VOD services firm ended Q1 with $18M in cash on its balance sheet. Liabilities included a $3M convertible promissory note.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • QUNR

    Qunar lower on EPS miss; Ctrip battle yields heavy marketing spend

    • Though Qunar's (QUNR -3.3%) Q1 revenue beat consensus by $3.9M, soaring spending led EPS to miss by $0.15. R&D spend rose 116.8% Y/Y to $19.5M, product sourcing spend 358.2% to $6.3M, sales/marketing spend 158.8% to $21M, and G&A spend 293% to $10.8M.
    • Also: Gross margin fell 170 bps Q/Q and 300 bps Y/Y to 78.1%, and $10.8M was spent on marketing for Qunar's Baidu Zhixin unit. Both Qunar and rival Ctrip (CTRP +0.1%) are spending heavily on promotions
    • The good news: Qunar expects Q2 revenue to grow 90%-95% Y/Y, an acceleration from Q1's 83.6% clip.
    • Mobile revenue rose 114% Q/Q and 415% Y/Y to $17.1M, and made up 31.7% of total revenue. Total Web users +3% Q/Q and +24% Y/Y to 241M; total mobile users +12% Q/Q and +86% Y/Y to 60.3M. Estimated flight ticket volume +75% to 17.5M; estimated room-night volume +100.7% to 5.9M.
    • Pac Crest (Outperform) has lowered its PT by $6 to $34 due to spending worries, but remains bullish long-term.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • SIG

    Bank of America weaves a tangled web in Zale-Signet merger

    • The efforts of Signet (SIG +0.1%) to acquire Zale (ZLC +0.8%) could be done in by deal adviser Bank of America Merrill Lynch's failure to disclose a conflict of interest.
    • BAML delivered a presentation to Signet last October in which it recommended to the company it make an offer to buy Zale for $17 to $21 per share. The investment bank then turned around to rep Zale in the merger talks while disclosing only "limited" prior relationships with Signet, according to The New York Times.
    • The apparent foul-up gives TIG Advisors even more ammunition to convince other Zale shareholders to oppose the merger.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • MPO

    Midstates Petroleum +11%, reportedly exploring potential sale

    • Midstates Petroleum (MPO +11.2%) pops higher on speculation of a potential sale; MPO is said to be working with Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs to solicit offers.
    • MPO has a market value of ~$418M, and total debt of more than $1.7B at the end of March.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • VJET

    Voxeljet higher following Q1 report, guidance reiteration

    • Voxeljet (VJET +2.5%) has reiterated its forecast for 2014 revenue to exceed €18M ($24.7M, good for 50%+ Y/Y growth); the consensus is at €18.2M. The company ended Q1 with a printer order backlog of €3.77M (six printers), up from €2.3M at the end of Q4.
    • Printer revenue rose 8.9% Y/Y in Q1 to €1.3M. 2 new 3D printers were sold vs. 3 in seasonally strong Q4 and 1 new and 1 used printer a year ago. Services revenue rose  20.7% to €1.4M.
    • Gross margin was 39.4% vs. 41.3% in Q4 and 38.2% a year ago. Opex rose 123% Y/Y to €2.1M, with admin expenses rising over 3x to €614K. R&D spend totaled just €848K.
    • Expectations are a lot lower than they were a few months ago.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: KGJI +30%. OVRL +25%. ESTE +22%. RAX +20%. SORL +16%. ZBB +15%. JCP +15%. DRWI +15%. DDS +14%. JWN +13%.
    • Top 10 Losers: WWE -43%. EVRY -35%. SBSA -23%. LOOK -17%. FORD -16%. GPRC -15%. CCIH -15%. OTC:VLTC -15%. RCON -14%. JE -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ESTE

    Earthstone Energy +20% on Oak Valley deal

    • Earthstone Energy (ESTE +19.8%) agrees to acquire the producing assets and undeveloped acreage of Oak Valley Resources plus $138M in cash in exchange for 9.1M ESTE common shares.
    • The combined company will have a total 2,750 boe/day of production, 14.6M in oil reserves, plus Oak Valley's 67K acres of oil and gas leasehold acreage, mostly in the Eagle Ford shale in south Texas.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • DHCP

    Walter Investment downgraded at Jefferies

    • Walter Investment (WAC -4.8%) continues to be punished after servicing procedures at its Green Tree subsidiary were found wanting earlier this week.
    • Today's downgrade is from analyst Daniel Furtado, who cuts to Hold with $27 price target (from $38), citing increased compliance costs, the sunset of HARP, and potentially higher capital costs as suggesting the likelihood of lower out-year earnings for the foreseeable future.
    • Furtado lowers his 2015 EPS estimate to $4.42 from $4.46, and says his numbers for that year and 2016 are on average 35% lower than Street consensus.
    • Previously: Walter Investment responds to negative compliance report
    • Previously: Walter Investment cut to Sell at Compass Point
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat higher on pre-earnings Wells Fargo upgrade

    • "Sentiment and a lumpy business can create attractive buying opportunities in stocks, and we view this as one of those times for VSAT," writes Wells Fargo's Andrew Spinola, upgrading shares (VSAT +2.8%) to Outperform. His valuation range has been lifted by $5 to $70-$74.
    • Spinola thinks near-term expectations "have been adequately reset" ahead of Tuesday's FQ4 report, after ViaSat posted an FQ3 miss and disappointing sub growth in February.
    • He still considers ViaSat "one of the best-positioned companies in satellite broadband," and calls shares attractively valued at 9x FY16E EBITDA. A 23% EBITDA CAGR is forecast through FY18.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • WDR

    Waddell & Reed off 3.7% amid exit of portfolio manager

    • Ryan Caldwell, co-portfolio manager of Waddell & Reed's (WDR -3.7%) Asset Strategy mutual funds has resigned. The Asset Strategy portfolio has about $44.7B in AUM, including $35.6B in the Ivy Asset Strategy fund. Caldwell has been with WDR since 2000 and in his current position since 2007.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • GOGO

    Gogo spikes after CEO, director disclose purchases

    • Gogo (GOGO +4.8%) CEO Michael Small bought 30K shares on Wednesday at $12.96. Director Charles Townsend bought 60K shares on Wednesday at $12.84, and another 100K on Thursday at $12.96.
    • The purchases come after the in-flight Wi-Fi provider's shares fell over 60% from a December high of $35.77, thanks largely to a momentum stock selloff and worries about AT&T's plans to offer a rival service.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 6 Comments
  • IVPAF

    Ivanhoe Mines considers break-up, as mining projects face funding crunch

    • Ivanhoe Mines says (OTCQX:IVPAF +7.2%) it is considering various options including splitting the company’s projects into separate publicly traded entities, asset sales, joint ventures and alternative stock exchange listings.
    • While Ivanhoe exited Q1 with $170M in cash, it has committed $146M for the Platreef project in South Africa, which leaves very little for development of its Kamoa and Kipushi deposits in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
    • Ivanhoe wants to begin developing a mine-access decline at Kamoa this year and conduct an underground drilling program at Kipushi, but it lacks funds to do so unless it can raise more by the end of June.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 5 Comments
  • TRUE

    TrueCar opens for trading at $9.70

    • TrueCar (NASDAQ:TRUE) opens for trading at $9.70. A tidy 7.8% premium over where the company's IPO priced, but well-below the $12 -$14 range where the company was looking to land.
    • Previous coverage: Pricing, IPO filing, IPO preview
    • Related ETF: IPO
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • SMCI

    Super Micro rallies on Stifel upgrade

    • Following an encouraging talk with CFO Howard Hideshima, Sifel has upgraded Super Micro (SMCI +6.1%) to Buy, and set a $23 PT.
    • Super Micro's shares took off last month in response to a strong FQ3 beat and healthy FQ4 guidance. The company has been bucking weak server industry demand in part by ramping sales of modular/rack-optimized servers for Internet data centers (growing quickly as a % of industry revenue).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining, Johnson Matthey reach five-year platinum deal

    • Stillwater Mining (SWC +2.3%) says it agreed to a five-year contract for platinum group metal refining and sales with Johnson Matthey (OTCPK:JMPLY).
    • The catalytic converter manufacturer will purchase all of SWC's mined palladium and a significant share of mined platinum, with SWC utilizing Johnson Matthey's refining services for all mined production and recycling material.
    • SWC says the deal secures favorable long-term pricing for its mined metal and competitive refining terms with an excellent partner to help grow its recycling business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • CCIH

    ChinaCache -11% in spite of revenue beat

    • ChinaCache's (CCIH -11.4%) Q1 revenue of $52.1M beat guidance of $50.1M-$50.9M. Q2 guidance is for revenue of $54.7M-$55.5M.
    • At the same time, gross margin (closely watched) fell to 30.5% from 31.7% in Q4 and 31.1% a year ago. On the CC (transcript), ChinaCache noted higher equipment depreciation/migration expenses offset lower bandwidth/colocation spend (as a % of  revenue).
    • The company mentioned cost controls are expected to keep a lid on opex over the near-term, but added capex will "continually increase" over the next two quarters due to investments in a new resource management system. It's expected to return to a level of ~10% of revenue afterwards.
    • A partnership with China Telecom isn't expected to boost Q2 sales, but might have an impact in Q3. Surging Chinese mobile data traffic (boosted by 4G network rollouts) is expected to provide a 2H lift.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • DDS

    Dillard's completes the department store double-digit trifecta

    • Dillard's (DDS +10.7%) is in full rally mode after beating EPS estimates with its Q1 report.
    • The department chain store chain grew comparable-store sales by 2% in Q1.
    • Consolidated gross margin rate was flat at 39.5% compared to a year ago.
    • Today's double-digit gain for Dillard's completes a department store trifecta with shares of J.C. Penney and Nordstrom also quite lively.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • JMEI

    Jumei jumps following IPO

    • After pricing its IPO at $22 (above a range of $19.50-$21.50), Jumei (NYSE:JMEI) opened at $27.25 and is now at $26.26, up 19.4%.
    • The Chinese online cosmetics retailer, estimated to have 22% of the local market by Frost & Sullivan, has a valuation of $3.77B, or ~8x 2013 sales. It raised $244M by selling 11.1M shares (upsized from a prior 9.5M).
    • Prospectus, IPO preview, analysis
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • GM

    GM presser on tap amid reports of fine and consent decree

    • The NHTSA and DOT will hold a joint press conference at 11:15 a.m. to discuss the General Motors (GM -1.1%) recalls.
    • CNBC is reporting the automaker has entered a consent decree with the government and will pay a hefty fine.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 11 Comments
  • CHKR

    Chesapeake Granite Wash -7.3% on Chesapeake spinoff news

    • Chesapeake Granite Wash Trust (CHKR -7.3%) is under pressure after Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.8%) revealed plans to proceed with a spinoff of its oilfield services operations by the end of next month as it also plans other asset sales.
    • Shares are also going ex-dividend today.
    • CHKR revenues and distributions depend on the timing of initial sales from CHK's development wells in which the trust receives an interest, as well as the sales volume and prices attributable to the Trust's royalty interests.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • IBN

    Gains cut in India following opposition election victory

    • A volatile session in India saw the Sensex close up 0.9% to an all-time high following the election victory by the opposition Bharatiya Janata Party and its prime minster candidate Narendra Modi. Stocks initially rose more than 6% as results came in, but "sell the news" action took over, given the Sensex's already big run in the weeks leading up to the election.
    • In ETF action action in the States, EPI +4.6%, PIN +3.5%.
    • Banks: ICICI Bank (IBN +6.7%), HDFC Bank (HDB +3.3%).
    • ETFs: EPI, INDY, SCIF, PIN, INP, INDL, INDA, INXX, SCIN, INCO, SMIN
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • RAX

    Rackspace skyrockets; Street sees plenty of potential suitors

    • "Because Rackspace (RAX +18.4%) operates the largest production deployment of OpenStack and is the [#2] public cloud provider to [Amazon], it could be a strategic asset to other companies ... such as AT&T, IBM, EMC, HP, and VMware," says Blair's Jim Breen following a Bloomberg report about Rackspace's hiring of Morgan Stanley to evaluate "inbound strategic proposals."
    • Worth noting: IBM, H-P, AT&T, and VMware already offer their own cloud infrastructure services, and VMware supports an OpenStack rival (its vCloud platform). Moreover, any potential buyer will likely take a close look at Rackspace's long-term ability to handle Amazon/Microsoft/Google's aggressive pricing.
    • Nonetheless, the Street sees plenty of possibilities, given Rackspace's size and OpenStack software/services investments. Dell and Cisco are a couple of the other names brought up. Blair thinks Rackspace could get $54/share, given recent deal prices.
    • Over 11% of the float was shorted as of April 30. Shares are up 29% since Bloomberg's report broke just before Thursday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar -8.7% on soft revenue guidance

    • Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ) had 500MW worth of Q1 module shipments, up from 340MW a year ago (albeit down from seasonally strong Q4's 621MW) and at the high end of its (favorably) revised guidance range of 490MW-500MW.
    • But the company is also guiding for Q2 revenue of $560M-$590M, below a $633.6M consensus. Module shipments are expected to total 600MW-630MW, up from 455MW a year ago.
    • Canadian is reiterating guidance for 2.5GW-2.7GW of full-year shipments (400MW-500MW linked to its solar projects), and $2.7B-$2.9B in revenue (consensus is already at $2.88B).
    • Gross margin was 14.7% (100 bps hit from a fire), down from 19.5% in Q4 and up from 9.7% a year ago, and in-line with guidance. GM is expected to rise to 17%-19% in Q2.
    • Americas sales rose to 43.6% of revenue from 32.1% in Q1, and Europe rose to 6% from 5.5%. Asia/other sales fell to 50.4% from 62.4%, with a Chinese slowdown (see Deutsche's comments) offsetting Japanese strength.
    • Inventory rose by $145.3M Q/Q to $376.4M. The company has a 1.2GW pipeline of late-stage utility-scale projects, nearly 800MW of which is in Canada and Japan.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ZBB +24%. RAX +24%. JCP +17%. CMGE +12%. SSLT +10%. DCIN +10%. JWN +9%. IBN +8%. ADSK +5%.
    • Losers: WWE -49%. CSIQ -10%. ICLD -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural -2.7% as Macquarie downgrades on weaker iron ore outlook

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) -2.7% premarket after Macquarie downgrades shares to Underperform with a $10 price target, reduced from $18, following an 8% reduction in 2014 iron ore price forecasts.
    • Macquarie expects CLF to burn cash as both iron ore and met coal prices remain low.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts dips below $200 in early trading on CS warnings

    • Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) lands on a list put out by Credit Suisse of overbought momentum-driven stocks.
    • The firm thinks Wynn could get unloaded in earnest by portfolio managers if the market sells off broadly.
    • WYNN -1.1% premarket to $199.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • DRI

    Early reaction to Darden's Red Lobster sale

    • It's a see-saw early session for Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) following news the company will sell Red Lobster for $2.1B.
    • The company is taking the unusual measure of funneling the proceeds back to buybacks and debt retirement which is a tip-off to some that more dramatic changes are on the way.
    • The deal price seems a bit low to some restaurant industry analysts, although the sale comes amid sluggish traffic patterns at Red Lobster. There's also the difficulty of uncoupling the combined Red Lobster-Olive Garden units.
    • What to watch: Darden CEO Clarence Otis has been the target of activist investors and analysts for quite a while on accusations of mismanagement. If early reaction is any indication, Otis is still firmly on the hot seat.
    • DRI -1.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • RYAAY

    Ryanair cuts flights in sweeping move

    • Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) has cut 222 routes for this summer, according to analysis from The Irish Times.
    • The company appears to be tightening its capacity in an effort to fly a higher mix of business travelers.
    • RYAAY -4.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • KMDA

    Kamada off premarket

    • Shares of Kamada (NASDAQ:KMDA) are off 30% in premarket trading on high volume in response to its report on its AAT clinical trial. Results were a bit of a mixed bag highlighted by a failure to achieve the primary endpoint.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom soars after healthy earnings beat

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) topped the estimate of analysts with its Q1 report after getting a boost from online sales and a 20% jump in revenue at Rack outlet stores.
    • Comparable-store sale were up 3.3% for the quarter.
    • The company said it's seeking a financial partner for its $2B credit card portfolio.
    • JWN +10.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM

  • World shares mixed

    • Global equities lack direction following a broad sell-off yesterday amid concerns of stalling growth in Europe.
    • India's Sensex is +1.5% - although down sharply from earlier highs - as Narendra Modi's opposition Bharatiya Janata Party looks poised to claim a massive victory in the country's election.
    • Japanese shares are down sharply, continuing the tendency for notable movements. Poor earnings are among the factors weighing on sentiment.
    • Japan -1.4%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China +0.1%.
    • Euro Stoxx 600 flat, London +0.1%, Paris -1.3%, Frankfurt flat, Milan +0.65%, Madrid +0.4%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow -0.05%, S&P flat, Nasdaq flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 AM
